transcript.text: the problem that we see in the last 15
years or so and it's very pronounced and
conspicuous when you move in the public
space is that people with whom you have
substantive disagreements about issues
that have identity level salience won't
have conversations with you they
absolutely refuse to speak to you that
is a necessary constitutive part of the
ideology so these are not leftists these
are not you know n gome Chomsky economic
leftist this is a new type of applied
postmodernism and within this ideology
you do not have conversation with
someone for fear of you know ideological
contamination moral contamination it's a
signal it's an in-group signal to your
tribe that if you go outgroup you're a
bad person so this makes those problems
incredibly difficult to solve especially
when the people who hold power in the
institutions they are the main people
like they have the power so why would
they want to have the conversation
